comments.commentBody: I totally agree with you. For me, Carrère is a master, a beautiful flawed human being. Such talent at writing what it means to be a man.

How CAN you write Houellebecq is routinely advanced as France ´s greatest living writer of fiction ? Who told you that ?  ONe of the best sellers but not of the greatest. Do you know Evhenoz, Michon, Bergougnioux, de Kerangal, and others ?
The author of the article has translated five books by Michon, and has written about de Kerangal.
It is a horrifyingly tedious production of an American classic.  I like the other work Gold has done, but this is directorial destruction at its worst.
I couldn't agree with your comments more.  I hate shows where all you see is the direction and not the performances and written word.  Al you see is the director's ego.
The guilty mind seats paranoia.

Please do not publish Mr. Trump's tweets that are only repeats of what he has read on another news outlet. You are just doing the saleswork of the other news outlet. If you wouldn't publish or reference the original article, don't do it merely because Mr. Trump likes it and tweets it.
Either 45 is delusional or he's revealed something that, maybe in the long run, he'll wish he hadn't
He is incapable of introspection and has some kind of a god complex.
Or both. Or all three.
Delusional.
So it's OK for Trump, during one of the debates, to invite Russia to hack Clinton's communications, but it's not OK for anyone to (allegedly) hack him.  Hypocrisy sure is a crowd pleaser.
Love your name!
So full of it.
What is going on? This just gets more bizarre by the day.

Yep, it's a daily dose of hysteria and insanity in the USA. Like has been said, you can't make this stuff up... Sadly it's basically a daily occurrence that some wild accusation will surface. So much for any moments of calm.
trump is unhinged. no telling how a crazy nitwit will react to anything.
Another attempt at deflection.
Nothing more to this story than this:  Trump is simply a liar.
A paranoid liar at that.

Not quite ALL. Trump is certifiably deranged. eg From the DSM-5:
Symptoms of Narcissistic Personality Disorder(Formerly megalomania)

The definition of NPD states that it comprises of a persistent manner of grandiosity, a continuous desire for admiration, along with a lack of empathy. It starts by early adulthood and occurs in a range of situations, as signified by the existence of any 5 of the next 9 standards (American Psychiatric Association, 2013):

A grandiose logic of self-importance.

A fixation with fantasies of infinite success, control, brilliance, beauty, or idyllic love.
A credence that he or she is extraordinary and exceptional and can only be understood by, or should connect with, other extraordinary or important people or institutions.

A desire for unwarranted admiration.

A sense of entitlement.

Interpersonally oppressive behavior.
A display of egotistical and conceited behaviors or attitudes
No form of empathy.

Resentment of others or a conviction that others are resentful of him. This characteristic is displayed in the Obama wiretap tweets (Bad (sick) guy.

When you look at the above criteria for NPD, where you only need to exhibit 5 of the 9 standards for this disease, Trump hits every mark.

America, when will you fix this problem & remove Trump ?
And a compulsive liar, at that.

This craziness is typical of Trump and the liars and low lifes in his admn. when they want to divert the media and citizens from the shenanigans going on with Russia, Sessions and the rest of his bunch of liars and possible traitors.  This idiocy is interesting but I hope the media will stay focused on the important things surrounding Trump and his minions.
cew --- I sure hope so too!
I'm afraid that most Trump supporters would qualify.
Impeach now, before he brings the whole country down with him.

The 25th Amendment provides for the president's removal from office if he is deemed unfit by the VP in: Section 4. Whenever the Vice President and a majority of either the principal officers of the executive departments or of such other body as Congress may by law provide, transmit to the President pro tempore of the Senate and the Speaker of the House of Representatives their written declaration that the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, the Vice President shall immediately assume the powers and duties of the office as Acting President."
Constitutional Amendment 25.

...that would mean Pence or worse yet Ryan would become President.....that may be going from the frying pan into the actual fire.....we need to remove all of the "bad hombres" that we currently pay to represent our best interests...and they clearly are not doing that. Clear them out, it's a cancer.

Whenever Trump feels the heat he 1) denies; 2) distracts; 3) normalizes and then if all of that fails to throw off the heat, he 4) attacks. Do not fall for any of it. When you see the attacks, you know that he is really feeling the heat. That is because he is hiding something really bad (the Russian connection) and it is close to being exposed.

Kind of like a grade school kid.

We will all see the light when his tax returns are released later this year, under Congressional subpoena, and all his financial connections with Russian oligarch connected banks will be exposed. It will all make sense...

Isn't that the M.O. of all politicians.
And opening up an investigation of such a level would include himself so if there is any truth to what he proclaims Obama did. It (Russian interaction) would all come out right. I find it hard to believe that he would open himself up in tha if he could be implicated in that way.

We'll see right....
Except a grade school kid has a decent chance of maturing into a responsible human being.

The height of arrogance, instability, and recklessness is now occupying the White House. We now have a president, who was outvoted by nearly 3 million people, making baseless accusations against his predecessor. Yet the leaders of the Republican Party stand silent, allowing this irresponsible conduct to continue day after day. They have a responsibility to speak out. Now.  Their silence is not only enabling this behavior, but encouraging more.  It is time to recognize that the stability of our nation (and leader) is highly questionable.  Speak now!

@William (and the 2600 readers who recommended this comment)

You REALLY think that the GOP are going to SUDDENLY grow spines? Where were they when Shrub was starting two unfunded wars? Where were they when unhinged Donny was spouting birtherism? “The investigators in Hawai’i! It’s unbelievable what they are finding!”

60 to 70 times they voted to repeal or defund Obamacare. These are the lowest IQ congress to ever inhabit the halls--Louis Gohmert (Don’t cast aspersions on my asparagus), Steve King (Calves as thick as melons); they invite Bibi Netanyahu to speak to the combined Senate and House to one-up Obama; freshman Senator Tom Cotton gets 47 of his comrades to send a letter to the Iranian clerics that the next president will be able to stop the deal “with a stroke of his pen.”

They have NO plan to replace Obamacare except with “tax credits” and “savings accounts” which will do NOTHING for the poor and most of the vanishing middle class.

Asking Congress to be responsible and speak out is like expecting Justice Clarence Thomas to be another Oliver Wendall Holmes Jr. or John Marshall!
But if they speak now their house of cards will collapse!

Republicans must be made to pay for their very dangerous behavior in 2018.  Remember, fellow citizens, voting is NOT a privilege it is a RESPONSIBILITY.  This is what happens when you stay home because "they are all crooked so it doesn't matter". Well it does matter.
Beautifully evocatively written. Described in a way that the scenes are vivid in my mind as a reader

I saw this production. As soon as Laura makes her entrance, disabled and wheelchair bound, someone in the script who is shy but ambulatory, the play lost me.
In the story, Laura leaves the apartment regularly, on her own, with her mother assuming she's going to typing classes. How did she get into the school building? Into tne the classroom? And when Laura's mother learns that she never went to the classes, confronts her with her deception and asks where she's been going instead of classes, Laura, on the stage, says "I've just been going out walking"(verbatim from the script) to which her mother responds "Walking? In winter? Deliberately courting pneumonia?"
It's one thing to have a "new take" on a great play, but this production assaults reason.
To me, your comment is typical of someone who hasn't bothered to see a production but imposes a strange defense based on the limited information shared by a journalist.

There's a lot of misuse of the term robot.  This article is typical.  The machines described in it are machine tools, not even simple robots.  A robot is not a machine run by a computer---that would make all computers robots.  No, a robot is a machine run by a computer that is able to carry out the majority of its instructions without input from a human.  These tools might move closer to being robots if they could do things like decide if there was work to to.  Or, even whether it should work.  That's far beyond  rudimentary "collaboration."  For such a sensitive subject, we shouldn't treat language casually.

The answer may be found in the article: The MIT Media Lab has found that "the robot was a teacher but also an experimental control for testing theories of the mind." Sounds like a valuable social engineering tool to me.

Ultimately, all problems require mastering the space between our ears.

The mention of Norbert Wiener's intention in coining the term "cybernetics" misstates both his goals and his actions. He—among many other scholars of the  1940s era, including Gregory Bateson, Margaret Mead, John von Neumann, Claude Shannon, and others from philosophy, psychiatry, neurophysiology, and more—recognized that certain systems could be construed as having goals and therefore could be studied effectively from that frame, regardless of whether they were mechanical, electrical, biology, or social. His conceptual work and its applications encompassed both "animal and machine", as Wiener's famous subtitle to his 1948 "Cybernetics" asserts, but his purpose was the study of purposive systems, not merely "the relationship between living beings and robots", as the article states. Cybernetics was a revolution that rocked the entire culture and which reverberates today. While the term has been diluted by appropriation of its prefix (cyberspace, cybersecurity...), cybernetics at least remains a placeholder for a discipline that stands as an effective lens for understanding human actions and interactions, human organizations and societies, and, yes, our relationship to the creatures we create in order to, hopefully, do what we want.

We just lack vision. We are trying to adapt human beings to technologies, when technologies is the mean, not the purpose. What do we want society to look like in 20 years ? How can Robots help ? These are the real questions. We need to switch mindset with foresight. The consumerist, quantitative growth, ROI, etc... current economic system is depleting nature. Vital environmental and ecological imperatives forbid us to continue in the manner that today’s consumerist model requires. An “economy of quality” must be invented, one that technological progress can contribute to. Let's mobilize collective intelligence and collective imagination to invent a new model and channel technological progress in this direction, one of a "sustainable humankind and planet".

Ridiculous.

Another wild, unfounded accusation in an early morning Twitter. I thought the adults in the house had taken away his phone.

If Trump really believed that Pres. Obama illegally wire tapped his phones, then, as President and as a private citizen, Trump could ask the Justice Department to investigate and bring felony wiretapping charges. Doesn't Trump know he is President? Or is he just throwing mud against the wall as a distraction?

Now, if there was wiretapping and it was done legally, then Mr. Trump has some problems. If this is the case, he'd better find himself a good personal lawyer.

Suggestion to The NY Times: Given Trump's habit of twittering baseless accusations and weird theories, do your readers and Trump a favor. Have a headline template at the ready: Pres. Trump's Latest Wild and Crazy Twitter Accusation.
Or better yet, devote a daily section: Today's Presidential Twitter Melt
And the headline should be written bold and uppercase.
Adults?  Brannon, Sessions, Conway?  Ha!
